general_advisory: In paddy crop, Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are the critical stages. Cover the rows with dry leaves in Sugarcane. Apply sprinkler irrigation to bring down the heat effect. Irrigate the maize crop to prevent water scarcity. Spread polythene in irrigation channels in sandy and loamy soils to save water wastage. Apply Streptocyclin in tomato and brinjal. Mulch coconut leaves around a coconut tree to reduce water loss. Cover vegetable seedlings with paper caps during daytime. Harvest fingerlings in shallow ponds if water temperature rises to 30°C.

advisory: Yellow stem borer management - To manage Yellow Stem Borer in paddy, spray Fipronil 5%SC @ 400ml/acre or Flubendiamide 20% WG @ 50g/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60ml/acre or Chromafenozide 80%WP @ 50g/acre.

Blast Disease Management - To manage blast disease in paddy, spray Hexaconazole 5% SC @ 400-ml/acre or Azoxystrobin 18.2% + Difenoconazole 11.4% SC @ 200-ml/acre or Tebuconazole 50%+ Trifloxystrbin 25% WG @ 80-gram/acre.

Early Shoot Borer - To manage early shoot borer in Sugarcane, irrigate the crop frequently during hot months. Timely cutting the attacked shoot at or just below the ground level ensures destruction of most of the caterpillar. Collect and destroy the egg masses manually. In furrow, apply Fipronil 0.3% GR @ 10 kg/acre at the time of first earthing up.
The high temperature increases the water requirement of maize crop. Irrigate the crop and avoid water stagnation in the field for more than six hours.
High temperature in day hours may lead to wilting in tomato. Apply 1g Streptocyclin in 10 liters of water in root zone.
Brinjal shoot and fruit borer - To manage this insect, install pheromone traps and spray neem-based pesticide or other insecticides as needed.
Mulch coconut leaves 1.8 m around a coconut tree to reduce water loss.
Cover with paper caps on the newly planted vegetable seedlings during day time.
In shallow ponds, harvest fingerlings if water temperature rises to 30°C. Ensure enough water depth before introducing fingerlings in a pond.
Tobacco Caterpillar Management - Check the migration of caterpillars and use insecticides for control.

After harvesting of onion, cut the tops leaving 2.0-2.5 cm above bulb. Dry the harvested bulb in a well-ventilated area.
Mango hopper - To control mango hoppers, spray recommended insecticides or use smoke below the plants to reduce pest population.
